title: Successful Appointment Scheduling
description: Verify that a patient can successfully book an appointment with valid details including visit type, consult type, practice type, health insurance, date, and time slot.

steps.description: Navigate to the Appointment Scheduling page.
Fill in patient personal details with valid data.
Select visit type, consult type, practice type, and health insurance.
Select a valid date with available time slots.
Choose an available 20-minute time slot.
Submit the appointment form.
Confirm that the appointment is created successfully.
Confirm patient record is created if new.
Verify redirection to the Confirmation page with correct appointment details and cancellation instructions.

title: Appointment Scheduling Input Validation
description: Verify that the system enforces client and server-side input validation for all fields in the appointment form and displays appropriate error messages.

steps.description: Navigate to the Appointment Scheduling page.
Leave required fields blank and attempt to submit.
Verify that validation errors are shown for missing mandatory inputs.
Enter invalid formats (e.g., invalid date formats, unsupported characters).
Ensure validation errors appear for invalid data formats.
Try to select a date or time slot outside available ranges.
Verify system blocks submission and shows appropriate message.

title: Time Slot Generation Respects Work Schedule and Existing Bookings
description: Ensure that available time slots generated dynamically exclude times outside the doctor's work schedule, unavailable days/times, and slots already booked or canceled.

steps.description: Query available time slots for a date within work schedule with existing appointments.
Confirm times outside work hours are not listed.
Confirm unavailable days and time slots are excluded.
Ensure already booked or canceled appointmentsâ€™ slots are removed from availability.
Retrieve available time slots for a day with no work schedule.
Verify no available time slots are returned.

title: Secure Appointment Cancellation with Token Verification and Time Policy
description: Validate that appointment cancellation requires a valid JWT-based token linked to an existing appointment and is only allowed if cancellation is requested at least 24 hours before the appointment time.

steps.description: Access the cancellation page using a valid token linked to a future appointment more than 24 hours away.
Confirm the system allows cancellation and shows confirmation option.
Confirm cancellation.
Verify appointment status is updated to canceled in the system.
Attempt cancellation with a valid token but less than 24 hours before the appointment.
Verify cancellation is rejected with a clear policy message.
Attempt cancellation with an invalid, expired, or tampered token.
Confirm cancellation fails and an error message about token validity is displayed.

title: Admin Authentication and Access Control
description: Verify secure login for admin users using JWT tokens, including correct credential verification, token issuance, protected route access, and logout functionality.

steps.description: Navigate to admin login dialog.
Enter valid admin credentials and submit.
Confirm JWT token is issued and stored securely.
Verify user is granted access to the Admin Dashboard.
Attempt to access admin protected routes without authentication.
Verify redirection to login or access denial occurs.
Logout from admin account.
Confirm JWT token is invalidated and protected routes become inaccessible.

title: Patient Phone Number Uniqueness Validation
description: Ensure the system prevents creation of duplicate patient records by enforcing phone number uniqueness during patient creation and updates.

steps.description: Attempt to create a new patient record with a phone number already assigned to another patient.
Verify validation error is returned preventing duplication.
Update an existing patient record to change the phone number to one already in use.
Confirm update is blocked and proper error message shown.
Create or update patient with a unique phone number.
Verify that operation succeeds.

title: Admin Dashboard Appointment and Work Schedule Management
description: Verify that admin users can view, create, update, and delete appointments and configure work schedules and unavailable days/times using the dashboard UI components.

steps.description: Login as admin and open the Admin Dashboard.
Navigate to appointment calendar and verify appointments are listed correctly.
Create a new appointment via admin interface.
Verify the appointment is added and reflected in the calendar.
Modify doctor's work schedule and save changes.
Confirm changes persist and affect available time slot generation.
Set unavailable days and time slots via UI.
Verify these days/times are excluded from availability.
Delete or update existing appointments and work schedules.
Ensure modifications are saved and reflected immediately.

title: Appointment Confirmation Page Display
description: Check that after booking, patients are shown a confirmation page with full appointment details and clear cancellation instructions.

steps.description: Complete a valid appointment booking flow.
Verify the Confirmation page loads with correct appointment info including date, time, visit type, and practice details.
Confirm cancellation link with secure token is displayed.
Ensure instructions about cancellation policy are clearly visible.

title: API Rate Limiting Enforcement
description: Validate that API endpoints enforce rate limiting to prevent abuse while allowing legitimate use without disruption.

steps.description: Perform repeated rapid API requests exceeding threshold limits.
Verify rate limiting responses (e.g., HTTP 429) are returned when threshold exceeded.
Perform legitimate API requests within limits.
Confirm that API responses are successful and normal.

title: Input Validation on API Endpoints Using Zod Schemas
description: Ensure all API endpoints validate inputs strictly according to Zod schemas including required fields, formats, and business rules, returning appropriate errors on invalid input.

steps.description: Send API requests with missing required fields to appointment creation, patient management, and authentication endpoints.
Confirm detailed validation errors are returned for each missing field.
Send API requests with invalid data types and formats.
Verify API rejects requests with appropriate error messages.
Send requests violating business rules (e.g. booking appointment on unavailable date).
Confirm API responds with clear business rule violation responses.

title: Push Notification Subscription and Notification Sending
description: Validate web push notification subscription management for patients and that appointment reminders, confirmations, and cancellations trigger appropriate push notifications.

steps.description: Subscribe a user to push notifications via the application interface.
Confirm subscription details are saved uniquely.
Trigger appointment confirmation event.
Verify push notification for confirmation is sent and received.
Trigger appointment reminder event.
Verify reminder notification delivery.
Trigger appointment cancellation event.
Confirm cancellation notification is pushed correctly.
Unsubscribe user from push notifications.
Verify subscription is removed and no notifications are sent thereafter.

title: Responsive and Accessible UI Rendering
description: Check that all major UI components render correctly and remain usable and accessible across supported device sizes and screen resolutions, including mobile and desktop.

steps.description: Open critical application pages such as Home, Appointment Scheduling, Confirmation, Cancellation, and Admin Dashboard on desktop browser.
Verify UI elements are properly aligned, visible, and functional.
Repeat UI checks on different mobile device emulator sizes.
Ensure UI components adapt responsively and remain accessible via keyboard and screen readers.
Check that error, loading, and confirmation dialogs display correct messages and maintain visual clarity.
Confirm no critical UI regressions or broken layouts are present.
